meanings.definition: A person who is irritatingly clever or sarcastic.
meanings.sent1: Some people find smartasses annoying because they are too clever for their own good.
meanings.sent2: She always has a witty comeback ready, making her the smartass of the group.
meanings.sent3: The smartass in the office made a joke during the meeting that lightened the mood.
meanings.sent4: His friends jokingly called him a walking thesaurus, a title he wore proudly as the resident smartass.
meanings.sent5: The smartass's quick wit and sharp tongue made him stand out in the crowd.

meanings.definition: To make a sarcastic or cheeky remark.
meanings.sent1: When she is in a playful mood, she loves to smartass her friends for a good laugh.
meanings.sent2: He tends to smartass whenever he feels the need to lighten the mood in a conversation.
meanings.sent3: The comedian decided to smartass the audience with a clever one-liner that had everyone chuckling.
meanings.sent4: She knew how to smartass her way out of any awkward situation with her quick wit.
meanings.sent5: The student couldn't resist the urge to smartass the teacher with a clever retort.
